abstract.p: Megan Padilla letter recalls CSA travel insurance paid for car rental, hotel, parking and meals when she and husband were stranded in Miami because of inclement weather after vacationing in Jamaica and Belize

block.p: To the Editor: Approaching the final leg of our homeward journey from Jamaica and Belize, my husband and I found ourselves stranded with thousands of people in Miami International Airport because of inclement weather. We approached the two-night and one-day delay as an opportunity. I remembered that we had purchased travel insurance. I called CSA's 24-hour emergency hot line, and learned that ''delays over 12 hours will be compensated up to $1,500 for reasonable accommodation and transportation expenses.''
We rented a Ford Explorer, chewed sticky Cinnabons (a favorite airport treat), and found ourselves a boutique hotel at a midweek bargain on South Beach's chic Ocean Drive.

To the Editor: Approaching the final leg of our homeward journey from Jamaica and Belize, my husband and I found ourselves stranded with thousands of people in Miami International Airport because of inclement weather. We approached the two-night and one-day delay as an opportunity. I remembered that we had purchased travel insurance. I called CSA's 24-hour emergency hot line, and learned that ''delays over 12 hours will be compensated up to $1,500 for reasonable accommodation and transportation expenses.''
We rented a Ford Explorer, chewed sticky Cinnabons (a favorite airport treat), and found ourselves a boutique hotel at a midweek bargain on South Beach's chic Ocean Drive.
CSA sent us a refund for 100 percent of our submitted receipts for car rental, hotel, parking and meals.
